title: Post Matric Scholarship to SBC Students 2022-23, Maharashtra
description: Post Matric Scholarship to SBC Students 2022-23, Maharashtra is an initiative of the VJNT, OBC, and SBC Welfare Department, Government of Maharashtra to financially help the SBC category students who have completed Class 10 and are continuing studies at post-matric level. The selected students will receive a maintenance allowance and other benefits.
eligibility:
To be eligible, an applicant must - 

be a resident of Maharashtra
belong to SBC category
be pursuing the education course at post-matric level approved by the government 
have obtained admission through CAP round (for students pursuing professional courses)
have 75% attendance for the current year

 
Note: Only 2 children of the same family are eligible to apply in the case of the boys, while any number of girls of the same family can apply.
benefits:
The selected candidates will receive the scholarship as follow - 
Group A: 

Hosteller: INR 425 per month
Day Scholar: INR 190 per month

Group B

Hosteller: INR 290 per month
Day Scholar: INR 190 per month

Group C

Hosteller: INR 290 per month
Day Scholar: INR 190 per month

Group D

Hosteller: INR 230 per month
Day Scholar: INR 120 per month

Group E

Hosteller: INR 150 per month
Day Scholar: INR 90 per month

Note - The maintenance allowance will be given to the selected students from admission to exam completion date.
50% of tuition fees and exam fees will be paid to OBC applicants who have taken admission in Government approved non-granted colleges in professional courses.
100% tuition fees, exam fees and maintenance allowance will be given to applicants who are studying in government/aided/non-aided institutions in professional courses and non-professional courses.
Note - If the applicant takes an admission on or before the 20th of any month should entitle date maintenance allowance will be issued for that current month. Otherwise, maintenance allowance will be entitled from next month.
documents:
Caste certificate (This certificate can be considered as the proof of residence)
Income certificate/Income Declaration
Caste validity certificate (Mandatory for Professional Degree courses and Professional Postgraduate courses)
HSC or SSC mark sheet or last examination mark sheet
Gap certificate is mandatory in case of any gap year
Death certificate of the father/guardian (if applicable)
Ration card to identify the number of children in the family
Leaving certificate
Declaration certificate of parents/guardian about the number of beneficiary children
how can you apply?:
Eligible candidates can apply for the scholarship through the following steps -
Step 1: Click on the 'Apply Now' button below.
Step 2: Click on 'New Applicant Registration'. 
Step 3: Fill in all required details, verify the email and phone number.
Step 4: Complete the Aadhaar authentication process either through OTP or biometrics. 
Step 5: The candidates will receive an OTP on their registered mobile number if they opt for OTP authentication.
Step 6: Complete the registration process by filling in all the required details.
Step 7: Log in using the username and password. 
Step 8: Complete the scholarship application, upload the necessary documents and submit.

title: Tuition Fees and Examination Fees to SBC Students, Maharashtra 2022-23
description: Tuition Fees and Examination Fees to SBC Students, Maharashtra 2022-23 is an initiative of the VJNT, OBC and SBC Welfare Department, Government of Maharashtra to financially help SBC category students studying from Class 11 to PhD level. The scholarship aims to create opportunities for SBC students by providing them with financial aid to pursue higher education. The selected students will receive tuition fees and exam fees reimbursement under this scheme.
eligibility:
To be eligible, an applicant must -

be a resident of Maharashtra
belong to SBC category
be taking post-matric education
be pursuing the education course approved by the government 
have taken admission in Government aided/Private Non-aided/private permanently non-aided courses
be pursuing a degree course in Health Science (Medical, Dental, Homeopathy, Unani, Ayurveda, Physiotherapy, Business Aid, Nursing)
have a diploma in Engineering, Pharmacology, HMCT
hold a postgraduate degree in MBA/MMS, MCA
hold one of the following diploma/degree -
	
Agricultural colleges (diploma)
Dairy Business Department (Diploma)
Colleges for Agricultural and Allied subjects (Degree and Post Graduate)
Agriculture and Bio-Technology Colleges (Degree and Post Graduate)
Agriculture and Food Technology Colleges (Graduate and Post Graduate)


have taken admission through CAP process (for professional courses)
have an annual family income of less than or equal to INR 8 lakh
benefits: 100% tuition fees and exam fees will be given to the selected applicants who are studying in government/aided/non-aided institutions in professional courses and non-professional courses.
documents:
Caste certificate issued by a competent authority
Income certificate/Income declaration issued by a competent authority
Caste validity certificate (for professional courses)
Marksheet of HSC or SSC or last examination
Gap certificate
CAP allotment letter (for professional courses)
Leaving certificate
Ration card to identify the number of children in the family
Declaration certificate of parents/guardian about the number of children beneficiaries
how can you apply?:
Eligible candidates can apply for the scholarship through the following steps -
Step 1: Click on the 'Apply Now' button below.
Step 2: Click on 'New Applicant Registration'. 
Step 3: Fill in all required details, verify the email and phone number.
Step 4: Complete the Aadhaar authentication process either through OTP or biometrics. 
Step 5: The candidates will receive an OTP on their registered mobile number if they opt for OTP authentication.
Step 6: Complete the registration process by filling in all the required details.
Step 7: Log in using the username and password. 
Step 8: Complete the scholarship application, upload the necessary documents and submit.

title: Dr. Punjabrao Deshmukh Vasatigruh Nirvah Bhatta Yojna 2022-23, Maharashtra
description: Dr. Punjabrao Deshmukh Vasatigruh Nirvah Bhatta Yojna 2022-23, Maharashtra is an initiative of the Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Maharashtra to financially help the students who are wards of registered labour/alpabhudharak (Marginal Land Holder) and who have taken admission in technical, professional or non-professional courses. The candidates studying in MMRDA/PMRDA/Aurangabad City/Nagpur City will be awarded INR  30,000 for 10 months and candidates studying in institutes located in other areas will be awarded INR 20,000 for 10 months.
eligibility:
To be eligible, an applicant must - 

be a resident of Maharashtra
be a child of registered labour/child of alpabhudarak 
have taken admission in Technical, Professional or Non Professional courses at graduation or postgraduation level
have an annual family income from INR 1 lakh to INR 8 lakh
benefits:
The selected candidates will receive the benefits in the following ways -
Professional Courses -  
For children of Registered Labor/Alpabhudharak (Marginal Land Holder) - 

Students studying in institutes located in MMRDA/PMRDA/Aurangabad City/Nagpur City - INR 30,000 for 10 months
Students studying in institutes located in other areas - INR 20,000 for 10 months)

For students having an annual family income of up to 1 lakh - 

For students studying in institutes located in MMRDA/PMRDA/Aurangabad City/Nagpur City - INR 10,000 for 10 months 
For students studying in institutes located in other areas - INR 8,000 for 10 months

For students having an annual family income of  INR 1 lakh to 8 lakh - 

For students studying in institutes located in MMRDA/PMRDA/Aurangabad City/Nagpur City - INR 10,000 for 10 months
For students studying in institutes located in other areas - INR 8,000 for 10 months. (Note - 33 % of seats are reserved for girls. If the seats are left then they will be given to the boys.)

For Non-Professional Courses - 
INR 2,000 annual for 10 months to students having an annual family income of INR 1 lakh
documents:
Marksheet
Domicile Certificate
Register Labor Certificate/Alpabhudharak (Marginal Land Holder) Certificate (In case of not a child of Alpabudharak or Registered Labour then family income certificate)
Undertaking “In the current year, not more than 2 beneficiaries from the same family”
CAP Related document
Hosteller documents
Attendance Certificate
Gap Related Documents (if Gap is there)
Previous year's marksheet
how can you apply?:
Eligible candidates can apply for the scholarship through the following steps -
Step 1: Click on the 'Apply Now' button below.
Step 2: Click on 'New Applicant Registration'. 
Step 3: Fill in all required details, verify the email and phone number.
Step 4: Complete the Aadhaar authentication process either through OTP or biometrics. 
Step 5: The candidates will receive an OTP on their registered mobile number if they opt for OTP authentication.
Step 6: Complete the registration process by filling in all the required details.
Step 7: Log in using the username and password. 
Step 8: Complete the scholarship application, upload the necessary documents and submit.

eligibility:

be studying a professional curriculum
be residing in a hostel (either a government hostel or institute's hostel or outside)
benefits:
The selected scholars will receive maintenance allowance as specified below -
For students who are residing in Government hostels - 

Course duration between 4 to 5 years: INR 700 per month (INR 7,000 per annum)
Course duration between 2 to 3 years: INR 500 per month (INR 5,000 per annum)
Course duration below 2 years: INR 500 per month (INR 5,000 per annum)

 
For students who are eligible for Government hostels but are not admitted to Government hostels - 

Course duration between 4 to 5 years: INR 1,000 per month (INR 10,000 per annum)
Course duration between 2 to 3 years: INR 700 per month (INR 7,000 per annum)
Course duration below 2 years: INR 500 per month (INR 5,000 per annum)

Group 4: INR 230 to 380

For Course Group E - INR 150 per month for hostellers and INR 90 per month for day scholars

Note - The maintenance allowance will be given to the selected students from admission to exam completion date.
50% of tuition fees and exam fees will be paid to OBC applicants who have taken admission in Government approved non-granted colleges in professional courses.
100% tuition fees, exam fees and maintenance allowance will be given to applicants who are studying in government/aided/non-aided institutions in professional courses and non-professional courses.
Note - If the applicant takes an admission on or before the 20th of any month should entitle date maintenance allowance will be issued for that current month. Otherwise, maintenance allowance will be entitled from next month.

title: Post-Matric Scholarship for Persons with Disability, Maharashtra 2022-23
description: Post-Matric Scholarship for Persons with Disability, Maharashtra 2022-23 is an initiative of the Department of Social Justice and Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra to provide financial assistance to disabled students of Class 11 to Ph.D. level. The selected scholars will receive maintenance allowance and other benefits.
eligibility:

benefits:

Group E - INR 230 per month

Group B and C - INR 820 per month
Group D - INR 570 per month
Group E - INR 380 per month


An additional allowance of INR 100 to blind candidates under Group A, B, and C; INR 75 to students under Group D and INR 50 to students under Group E
